JobFullDesc: Our team is building the next-generation of OneNote and we are looking for a full-stack web engineer to join our team! We are rapidly building new experiences around how users take, collaborate, and manage their notes, allowing them to use the power of OneNote today in Teams, Outlook, Office, and more. We go beyond OneNote Notebooks, like the OneNote Feed, allowing users to find Sticky Notes, OneNote pages, and Samsung Notes while they write an email. If you are interested to hit the ground running to bring together this experience, we’d love to hear from you.   The OneNote team at Microsoft is responsible for OneNote, Sticky Notes, and some other cool future stuff we can’t talk about yet. Our mission is to empower people to Remember, Think, Organize, and Act so they can Achieve More with less effort. We want to bring outstanding tools for capturing information, refining thoughts, and sharing ideas to every single person in the world so everyone can be more creative.  We are looking for creative problem solvers and diverse thinkers, people who care about culture as well as customers, business, and engineering. We believe that how we do things is at least as important as what we do.Big vision, a common purpose, passion for quality, curiosity as well as grit, and investment in fun and collaboration are what lead to great results. No matter the platform it is our job to deliver clean, consistent, useful world class Notes experiences.  This position is full-time and based at our Redmond office. #NotesJobs ResponsibilitiesParticipate in the technical design and implementation of fast and fluid web experiences on OneNote and assure quality for engineering workCollaborate with team members to deliver features, and improve engineering systemsBe highly motivated and demonstrate willingness to learn and to grow within the roleInvest in others’ growth and mentor team members and build highly capable teamsA passion for deeply understanding customer needs, and bringing customer perspective to daily workQualificationsRequired: 5+ years of Software Engineering experience2+ years of experience in shipping high-quality products or services2+ years of experience with JavaScript or TypeScriptBachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field, or 7+ years of industry experience Preferred: Experience designing, developing, deploying and evolving web-based user experiences and servicesExperience with React, Fluid Framework, Redux, Azure, and/or SharePointExperience developing apps in Microsoft TeamsStrong problem solving, debugging, and troubleshooting skillsDemonstrable experience in driving key architectural decisions, designs and implementation at scaleExperience with cross-discipline and cross-team collaborationLeadership skills, displayed via official management experience or clear examples of effectively leading groups of engineersExcellent technical communication skillsExperience analyzing and improving full-stack web & service efficiency and reliability  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
